file.patch:
@@ -511,7 +511,7 @@
     <format property="year" pattern="yyyy" locale="en"/>
   </tstamp>
 
-  <filterset id="version.filters">
+  <filterset id="year.filters">
     <filter token="YEAR" value="${year}"/>
   </filterset>
 
@@ -531,6 +531,9 @@
     <echo level="info">jmeter.version = ${jmeter.version}</echo>
     <echo level="info">display.version = ${display.version}</echo>
     <echo level="info">implementation.version = ${implementation.version}</echo>
+    <filterset id="version.filters">
+      <filter token="VERSION" value="${display.version}"/>
+    </filterset>
   </target>
 
     <!-- Get version from SVN status -->
@@ -872,10 +875,12 @@
    <mkdir dir="${resources.meta-inf}" />
     <copy todir="${resources.meta-inf}" overwrite="yes" filtering="yes"
         encoding="${encoding}">
-      <filterset refid="version.filters"/>
+      <filterset refid="year.filters"/>
+      <filterset refid="version.filters" />
       <fileset dir="${res.dir}/META-INF" >
         <include name="*.license" />
         <include name="*.notice" />
+      	<include name="jmeter_as_ascii_art.txt" />
       </fileset>      
     </copy>
     <fixcrlf encoding="${encoding}" srcdir="${resources.meta-inf}" eol="crlf" includes="*.license *.notice"/>
@@ -928,7 +933,7 @@ run JMeter unless all the JMeter jars are added.
 
     <!-- JMeter launch jar -->
     <jar jarfile="${dest.jar.jmeter}/ApacheJMeter.jar"
-        includes="**/NewDriver*,**/DynamicClassLoader*,**/ShutdownClient.class,**/jmeter_as_ascii_art.txt"
+        includes="**/NewDriver*,**/DynamicClassLoader*,**/ShutdownClient.class"
         basedir="${build.core}"
         manifest="${build.dir}/MANIFEST_BIN.MF">
         <manifest>
@@ -938,6 +943,8 @@ run JMeter unless all the JMeter jars are added.
           fullpath="META-INF/NOTICE" />
         <zipfileset file="${resources.meta-inf}/default.license"
           fullpath="META-INF/LICENSE" />
+        <zipfileset file="${resources.meta-inf}/jmeter_as_ascii_art.txt"
+          fullpath="org/apache/jmeter/jmeter_as_ascii_art.txt" />
     </jar>
 
     <!-- core -->

  • Bug 46993 - Saving from Header Manager generates ClassCastException
  • Bug 47009 - Insert parent caused child controller name to be reset
  • Bug 47064 - fixes for Mac LAF

@@ -803,7 +803,9 @@ If omitted, , is used. Note that , would need to be specified as < The XPath function reads an XML file and matches the XPath. Each time the function is called, the next match will be returned. At end of file, it will wrap around to the start. - Note that the entire file is held in memory, so this function should not be used for very large files. + If no nodes matched, then the function will return the empty string, + and a warning message will be written to the JMeter log file. + Note that the entire NodeList is held in memory.

message:
Fix NPE in active thread counts for remote tests

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/jmeter/branches/rel-2-2@498477 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

Former-commit-id: 29e99cae2037cd8b078e17825bfe5473393678b9

file.patch:
@@ -29,7 +29,8 @@

Version 2.2.1

Known problems:

-

As for 2.2 except as noted below.

+

Thread active counts are always zero in CSV and XML files when running remote tests. +

Incompatible changes:

@@ -67,6 +68,7 @@ jmeterthread.reversePostProcessors=true

  • Fix ClassCast Exception when using sampler that returns null, e..g TestAction
  • Bug 41277 - add Latency and Encoding to CSV output
  • Bug 41414 - Mac OS X may add extra item to -jar classpath
    • +
  • Fix NPE when saving thread counts in remote testing

    • Version 2.2

@@ -110,6 +110,8 @@ The order of appearance of columns is fixed, and is as follows:
  • failureMessage - if any
  • bytes - number of bytes in the sample
  • URL
    • +
  • latency - time to first response
    • +
  • encoding

    • The format of the XML files is as follows: @@ -247,6 +249,10 @@ The sample attributes have the following meaning: ngNumber of active threads in this group naNumber of active threads for all thread groups + +The active thread counts are always zero for remote tests. +This is a restriction of the current implementation (2.2.1) +

    Versions 2.1 and 2.1.1 of JMeter saved the Response Code as "rs", but read it back expecting to find "rc". This has been corrected so that it is always saved as "rc"; either "rc" or "rs" can be read.
